intro: Eleutherostylis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees in Australia. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces white or pinkish flowers that bloom during the spring. The plant relies on its host for water and some nutrients, while it photosynthesizes to some extent on its own. Eleutherostylis is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to thrive in humid, subtropical climates. Its berries are an important food source for native birds and other wildlife.
